skill.name: web-ai-prompt-api
skill.description: Chrome's built-in Prompt API implementation guide. Use Gemini Nano locally in browser for AI features - session management, multimodal input, structured output, streaming, Chrome Extensions. Reference for all Prompt API development.
skill.summary: Chrome's built-in Prompt API implementation guide. Use Gemini Nano locally in browser for AI feature...
skill.author: AJV009

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing reference material for Chrome's Prompt API. All 93 static findings are false positives from pattern matching on documentation text. The skill contains no executable code, makes no network requests, accesses no files, and executes no commands.

content.user_title: Implement Chrome Prompt API with Gemini Nano
content.value_statement: Build on-device AI features using Chrome's built-in Prompt API with Gemini Nano. Process text, images, and audio locally in the browser for privacy-sensitive applications without external server calls.
actual_capabilities: Check Chrome Prompt API availability and model parameters
Create and manage AI sessions with custom temperature and topK settings
Process multimodal input including text, images, and audio files
Generate structured JSON output with JSON Schema response constraints
Stream responses for long-form content generation
Clone and restore sessions for parallel conversations with shared context
limitations: Desktop Chrome only - no mobile Android or iOS support
Requires 22 GB storage for Gemini Nano model download
Output is text-only even with multimodal input capabilities
No Web Workers support due to permission policy restrictions

use_cases.title: Build AI-Powered Extensions
use_cases.description: Create browser extensions with on-device AI for content analysis, classification, and intelligent search without server costs.

use_cases.title: Process Sensitive Data Locally
use_cases.description: Build web applications that analyze medical records, financial data, or personal information locally without external API calls.

use_cases.title: Enable AI Without Internet
use_cases.description: Add AI features that work offline for field workers, travelers, or users with unreliable internet connections.

prompt_templates.title: Check API Support
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if the Chrome Prompt API is available in my browser. Show me the availability status and what model parameters are supported.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Session
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a LanguageModel session with default parameters. Generate a haiku about coding.

prompt_templates.title: Extract Structured Data
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a session with JSON Schema constraints to extract product name, price, and rating from this product description. Return valid JSON.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Images Locally
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure a multimodal session for image input. Analyze this uploaded screenshot and describe the UI elements you see.

output_examples.input: How do I check if Chrome Prompt API is available?
output: â€¢ Use await LanguageModel.availability() to check status
â€¢ Always check availability before creating sessions
â€¢ Verify you have Chrome 138+ and 22 GB free storage
â€¢ Check chrome://on-device-internals for model download status

output_examples.input: Generate hashtags for my blog post using structured output
output: â€¢ Create JSON Schema with type 'object' and 'hashtags' array property
â€¢ Set pattern '^#[^\s#]+$' to ensure valid hashtag format
â€¢ Use session.prompt() with responseConstraint parameter
â€¢ Model returns valid JSON you can parse safely
â€¢ Use omitResponseConstraintInput to exclude schema from quota

output_examples.input: How can I preserve conversation context across page refreshes?
output: â€¢ Store initialPrompts array and session parameters in localStorage
â€¢ On page load, retrieve stored data and pass to LanguageModel.create()
â€¢ Track user and assistant messages after each prompt
â€¢ Append new messages to initialPrompts array
â€¢ Save updated conversation history to localStorage

best_practices: Keep one empty session alive to prevent model unloading and reloading delays
Use AbortController with signal parameter to let users cancel long-running generations
Clone sessions instead of recreating when you need parallel conversations with shared context
anti_patterns: Creating new sessions for every request instead of reusing (model reload is expensive)
Ignoring inputUsage and inputQuota limits until the session fails
Assuming the Prompt API is available without checking before creating sessions

faq.question: What Chrome version supports the Prompt API?
faq.answer: Chrome 138+ for extensions in stable channel. Web apps require origin trial registration. Check chrome://on-device-internals for model status.

faq.question: How much storage does Gemini Nano require?
faq.answer: The model needs 22 GB free storage for download. Chrome automatically removes it if available storage drops below 10 GB after installation.

faq.question: Can I use this API in Chrome extensions?
faq.answer: Yes. The Prompt API is available in Chrome 138+ stable for extensions without origin trial permissions. Remove expired aiLanguageModelOriginTrial permission.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers when using Gemini Nano?
faq.answer: No. Gemini Nano runs completely on-device. All processing happens locally in the browser without any external network requests.

faq.question: Why is the model unavailable even with Chrome 138 installed?
faq.answer: Check: 22 GB free storage, 4+ GB GPU VRAM or 16 GB RAM, supported OS version, and enable chrome://flags/#prompt-api-for-gemini-nano-multimodal-input.

faq.question: How does on-device AI compare to cloud APIs like Claude?
faq.answer: On-device offers privacy and zero latency but smaller context windows and less capability. Best for privacy-sensitive or offline scenarios.
